author: radekkapka
content: I would prefer returning a new object. This would mean that these endpoints can return a heterogenous array in case the node has both types of attestations in the pool.

author: radekkapka
content: This would probably necessitate a `v2` for Electra

author: tersec
content: i.e. would prefer avoiding heterogeneous object list return

author: radekkapka
content: in order to avoid this, it should be explicitly mentioned in the spec that `v1` returns pre-Electra attestations and `v2` returns post-Electra ones

author: tersec
content: and realistically I'm not sure it makes sense to "mix" the attestations anyway in clients, though I guess in the upcoming interop there might be some discussion about deneb attestations in electra

author: tersec
content: which traditionally has worked by default because the attestation format hadn't changed

author: tersec
content: i.e. there was no real problem attesting to capella blocks in deneb, mechanically

author: radekkapka
content: Yeah, this might realistically happen only at the beginning of Electra. The pool might have some Deneb atts sitting in it when the fork happens

author: tersec
content: and that's edge-casey enough I'd want to see compelling evidence it has to be handled to add permanent complexity for a situation which will last maybe a couple epochs

author: tersec
content: relevant to this API design because in general they won't be mixed anyway

author: radekkapka
content: Agreed it's an edge case. Maybe it is enough to add a fork/version dropdown that changes the result schema and example

author: tersec
content: well, as long as it doesn't break compatibility with existing `v1`, that seems potentially ok too
